abstract: While Jamie Dimon, the chief executive of JPMorgan Chase, has agreed to testify before a Congressional committee in June to discuss the bank’s recent multibillion-dollar trading loss, he has not committed to a date.
snippet: While Jamie Dimon, the chief executive of JPMorgan Chase, has agreed to testify before a Congressional committee in June to discuss the bank’s recent multibillion-dollar trading loss, he has not committed to a date.
lead_paragraph: Jamie Dimon, the chief executive of JPMorgan Chase, has agreed to testify before a Congressional committee in June to discuss the bank’s recent multibillion-dollar trading loss.

headline.main: Dimon Agrees to Testify, Without Committing to Specific Date
